data.title: Frances Langford
data.text:
AKA Frances Newbern

Born: 4-Apr-1914

Birthplace: Lakeland, FL

Died: 11-Jul-2005

Location of death: Jensen Beach, FL

Cause of death: Heart Failure

Remains: Cremated (ashes scattered at sea)

Gender: Female

Race or Ethnicity: White

Sexual orientation: Straight

Occupation: Singer

Nationality: United States

Executive summary: Hooray for Hollywood

Husband: Jon Hall (actor, m. 4-Jun-1934, div. 1955)

Husband: Ralph Evinrude (business heir, m. 6-Oct-1955, d. 1986)

Husband: Harold Stuart (USAF official, m. 18-Nov-1994, until her death)

Hollywood Walk of Fame 1500 Vine St.

Tonsillectomy

FILMOGRAPHY AS ACTOR

The Glenn Miller Story (10-Dec-1953) · Herself

Purple Heart Diary (12-Nov-1951) · Herself

Deputy Marshal (28-Oct-1949)

Melody Time (27-May-1948) · Herself [VOICE]

Beat the Band (19-Feb-1947)

The Bamboo Blonde (15-Jul-1946)

Radio Stars on Parade (1-Aug-1945)

Girl Rush (21-Oct-1944)

Career Girl (11-Jan-1944)

This Is the Army (29-Jul-1943) · Herself

Cowboy in Manhattan (21-May-1943)

Yankee Doodle Dandy (6-Jun-1942) · Singer

Swing It Soldier (7-Nov-1941)

All-American Co-Ed (31-Oct-1941) · Virginia

Too Many Girls (8-Oct-1940) · Eileen Eilers

Hollywood Hotel (20-Dec-1937) · Alice

Born to Dance (27-Nov-1936) · "Peppy" Turner

Broadway Melody of 1936 (25-Aug-1935) · Herself

Every Night at Eight (2-Aug-1935)
